name: Walkin in the Rain (Pink OSB Edition)
description: 12" x 8" (approx) Acrylic, Spray Paint and POSCA on OSB Why OSB? Artwork using spray paint looks great on walls, but often they can look a bit flat when transferred onto canvas. The natural (well, man made!) texture of OSB really adds something to these paintings and gives them a great street look! These wood paintings on OSB are always a talking point and will make a great addition for any art collection, at home... or garage!

name: Salt Flats Racer 3 (2013)
description:
19.5cm x 61cm Acrylic and Spray paint on OSB. Salt flats racing is an activity that has been going on since the 1910's, but became very popular in the 1930's. I think there is a certain glamour and romance to the quest for speed in this period, and that quest still continues today.
Why OSB? Artwork using spray paint looks great on walls, but often they can look a bit flat when transferred onto canvas. The natural (well, man made!) texture of OSB really adds something to these paintings and gives them a great street look! These wood paintings on OSB are always a talking point and will make a great addition for any art collection, at home... or garage!

name: 1929 Golden Arrow (2013)
description:
30cm x 61cm Acrylic, Charcoal and Spray painting on OSB
Why OSB? Artwork using spray paint looks great on walls, but often they can look a bit flat when transferred onto canvas. The natural (well, man made!) texture of OSB really adds something to these paintings and gives them a great street look! These wood paintings on OSB are always a talking point and will make a great addition for any art collection, at home... or garage!

name: Another Monday Morning (2012)
description:
39cm x 70cm Acrylic and Spray Painting on OSB A view of the bridge outside my window... One Monday morning, I happened to looking out and there were three people battling against the wind and rain on their way to work. I immediately grabbed my sketchbook and this is the resulting painting.
Why OSB? Artwork using spray paint looks great on walls, but often they can look a bit flat when transferred onto canvas. The natural (well, man made!) texture of OSB really adds something to these paintings and gives them a great street look! These wood paintings on OSB are always a talking point and will make a great addition for any art collection, at home... or garage!

name: Another Knaresborough Night (2012)
description:
60cm x 39cm Acrylic and Spray Painting on OSB.
Why OSB? Artwork using spray paint looks great on walls, but often they can look a bit flat when transferred onto canvas. The natural (well, man made!) texture of OSB really adds something to these paintings and gives them a great street look! These wood paintings on OSB are always a talking point and will make a great addition for any art collection, at home... or garage!

name: Emley Moor Mast (2012)
description:
60cm x 39cm Acrylic and Spray Painting on OSB. Emley Moor mast, Yorkshire, recognizable to many people from the North of England as a sign they are nearly home after long trips south.
Why OSB? Artwork using spray paint looks great on walls, but often they can look a bit flat when transferred onto canvas. The natural (well, man made!) texture of OSB really adds something to these paintings and gives them a great street look! These wood paintings on OSB are always a talking point and will make a great addition for any art collection, at home... or garage!

name: Tinsley Towers (2012)
description:
40cm x 80cm Acrylic and Spray Painting on OSB A painting I'd been meaning to do for a few years... in memory of the Tinsley Towers. There's definitely something missing now as you drive along that stretch of the M1.
Why OSB? Artwork using spray paint looks great on walls, but often they can look a bit flat when transferred onto canvas. The natural (well, man made!) texture of OSB really adds something to these paintings and gives them a great street look! These wood paintings on OSB are always a talking point and will make a great addition for any art collection, at home... or garage!

name: BERT - Bert
description:
All Bert's are one-off drawings on reused cardboard and are great for collecting!! They are framed in a plain black 10cm x 15cm Ikea frame.
Bert was created somewhere, at sometime... probably in a lab. He has no mouth, and so, must communicate using his signs. This makes him a rather disgruntled little fella most of the time. But, despite this, he still has plenty of heart and loves to share his thoughts with you. And, he is quite cute... but don't tell him that to his face!

name: BERT - Happy Birthday
description:
This Bert just wants to wish you (or a close friend/family/pet) a Happy Birthday... why send a greeting card when you can send a Bert?! All Bert's are one-off drawings on reused cardboard and are great for collecting!! They are framed in a plain black 10cm x 15cm Ikea frame.
Bert was created somewhere, at sometime... probably in a lab. He has no mouth, and so, must communicate using his signs. This makes him a rather disgruntled little fella most of the time.
